0.cdata!: Global Environment Facility Trust Fund Grant

trustfund:
TF032718-POLAND - FOREST BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION,TF031280-POLAND -FORESTRY BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION,TF021685-GET-FOREST BIODIVERSITY
            PROTECTION PROJ.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Forest Biodiversity Protection
            project will initiate programs to conserve the biodiversity
            of key endangered forests and will provide institutional
            support to the Ministry of Environment, Natural Resources
            and Forestry (MENRF) to undertake biodiversity conservation
            management activities, including the establishment of a
            forestry gene bank.  The GEF operation will support
            Poland's effort to protect its forest ecosystems.
            Selection of the parks, reserves and zones under the project
            are based on agreed conservation priorities.  Project
            investments include: (i) institutional support to the MENRF
            to enable it to carry out its biodiversity conservation
            management activities including the establishment of
            facilities for ex-situ conservation of genetic material in
            the Sudety forests of Southwest Poland and for a
            biodiversity protection program for Bialowieza Primeval
            Forest (BPF) ecosystem of Eastern Poland; and (ii)
            investment in programs to preserve endangered forest
            ecosystems for biodiversity conservation through provision
            of funding for pilot investments in air and soil monitoring
            equipment, a forest gene bank and related archival nursery
            equipment, land planning equipment, air and soil monitoring
            equipment (fixed and mobile), protected area planning,
            financial support for a program for supporting transition to
            ecological agriculture for farmers operating within the BPF,
            and professional development, training and consulting services.
